data.title: Last Action Hero: Win the Schwarzenegger classic on 4K!
data.meta_description: Nineties sci-fi action classic Last Action Hero is coming to 4K UHD and we have FIVE copies to give away!
data.text:
“Here, in this world, the bad guys can win!” Well, here in the SciFiNow world we love classic Nineties Schwarzenegger sci-fi and that includes director John McTiernan’s action adventure, Last Action Hero.

To celebrate the movie getting the 4K Ultra HD release it deserves, we’re giving away an epic five copies of the film on 4K UHD!

Hit that nostalgia button and check out the trailer below…

Last Action Hero follows young Danny Madigan (Austin O’Brien), a lonely 11-year-old boy who escapes from his bleak reality by watching the action adventure movies of his favorite film character, Jack Slater (Arnold Schwarzenegger).

When his best friend, Nick the projectionist, gives him a special ticket to the new ‘Slater’ film, Danny is magically transported into Jack’s world, where the good guys always win. Danny becomes his helper as Jack battles a trio of nefarious bad guys, Benedict (Charles Dance), Vivaldi (Anthony Quinn) and The Ripper (Tom Noonan). But things get out of hand when Benedict steals Danny’s magic ticket stub and transports himself into the real world, where crime can, and often does, pay.

Jack and Danny must leave fictional Los Angeles for real-life New York and battle the villains without the aid of movie magic or stuntmen…

The new 4K edition comes complete with the movie newly remastered in 4K resolution from the original camera negative, with HDR10 and all-new Dolby Atmos audio plus loads of bonus features including an audio commentary with John McTiernan and an alternate ending presented in 4K with HDR10.
